title: Separating Terms
text: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following: $$\frac{45x^3 y^4}{5x y}+\frac{60x y^2}{5x y}$$
speech: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following:  fraction, 45 x cubed y to the fourth, over, 5 x y,  plus fraction, 60 x y squared, over, 5 x y,
pacedSpeech: Separate the terms so that it forms multiple fractions with the same denominator. It will result in the following:   fraction, 45 x cubed y to the fourth, over, 5 x y,  plus fraction, 60 x y squared, over, 5 x y,

title: Simplify Terms
text: What is the result once each fraction term is simplified?
speech: What is the result once each fraction term is simplified?
pacedSpeech: What is the result once each fraction term is simplified?
